column4: Why does Ubuntu pop up with a message sometimes saying that "Your login keyring was not unlocked. Enter your password."
Sarbull: Did this ever happen with Windows?
Sarbull: Because the M11x is just sorta notorious for overheating.
Sarbull: Do you think it's overheating because you feel heat, or because you are using a heat monitor? Also, did this ever happen with Windows?
Sarbull: Because if you just feel it near the fan, that just means that the fan is working.
Sarbull: My laptop is always warm near the fan. But the rest of it is fine. It's just the fan doing its job.
the proccesor is fine, around 40 degrees, the nvidia chipset is the problem, it should be turned off ..
Alright.
how can i disable a hardware component?
in the bios, there are only two options: ON and "the opportunity for turning it on by some keyboard combinations" FN+F6 in windows ..
interesting link, i'm reading it right now
i used that option, the battery drops to 1:30 hours and the resolution changes to 1024x768, BAD!
m11x have two video, nvidia and vga, now i'm working on the vga .. but the nvidia is heated up .. so i guess that's the problem..
And turning the Nvidia off ruins your resolution.

turning it on from the bios, i dont know if the nvidia is turned on right now, on windows, when i turn off the nvidia, the system is cool enough for no worries, but when i turn nvidia back on, on windows it heats up ..
now i am on ubuntu, and i think it is turned on but not using it ..
So the problem here is that the nvidia overheats even when not in use?
i used blacklist nouveu, blacklist nv, blacklist nvidia
now i have another problem, the screen went down to 640 by 480 pixels and the screen is 4:3
the thing is that the ubuntu logo at start up is full screen at 1366x768, dafuq dude?
